results:
Based on the search results, I found several Polish theater productions and stage adaptations of Anna Karenina. Here are the main ones:

## Ballet Productions

The most prominent is a ballet adaptation at Teatr Wielki Opera Narodowa (Polish National Opera) in Warsaw, choreographed by Alexei Ratmansky with music by Russian composer Rodion Shchedrin (originally created for his wife, legendary prima ballerina Maya Plisetskaya in 1972).

There was also a ballet production at Teatr Wielki im. Stanisława Moniuszki in Poznań in 2017, featuring soloists from the theater's ballet company.

## Dramatic Theater Productions

Teatr Powszechny im. Jana Kochanowskiego in Radom staged a dramatic adaptation directed by Grigorij Lifanov with scenography by Wojciech Stefaniak and costumes by Zofia de Ines-Lewczuk. This production premiered in September 2013.

Lubuski Teatr im. Leona Kruczkowskiego in Zielona Góra presented Anna Karenina after a 35-year absence from Polish dramatic theater stages, adapted by Radosław Paczocha and directed by Michał Kotański in 2012.

Teatr Polskiego Radia (Polish Radio Theater) produced a radio drama adaptation in 2018, adapted by Magdalena Wleklik and directed by Katarzyna Michałkiewicz.

Teatr Studio in Warsaw also staged a production using a new adaptation by British writer Helen Edmundson, which gave Tolstoy's story a contemporary theatrical form.

## Historical Productions

The search results also mention several older productions in Polish theaters:
- 1958 production at Teatry Dramatyczne in Wrocław directed by Jakub Rotbaum
- 1961 production for Teatr Telewizji directed by Adam Hanuszkiewicz
- 1976 production at Teatr Śląski in Katowice directed by Lidia Zamkow

These productions demonstrate that Anna Karenina has been adapted multiple times for Polish stages, both as dramatic theater productions and ballet performances, with various directors and theaters offering their interpretations of Tolstoy's classic novel.
